required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In-Home Use Study to Evaluate Use of an Intimate Health Product in Females
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-blind, Multi-center, In-home Use Study to Evaluate Sexual Enhancement Effects of Product PD-F-5394 in Females

lead_sponsor.agency: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

clinical_study.source: Johnson & Johnson Consumer and Personal Products Worldwide

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of an intimate health product on sexual experience in females.

detailed_description.textblock: Study to evaluate consumer perceptions of a cosmetic intimate health product on sexual experience in females, using a validated psychometric questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the effect of product on sexual enhancement by comparing baseline questionnaire responses to the end of study questionnaire responses
primary_outcome.time_frame: End of study (3 weeks after baseline visit)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Assessments will consist of monitoring and recording all non-serious Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), their frequency, severity, seriousness, and relationship to the investigational product.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: throughout duration of the study (+ 30 days for spontaneously reported SAEs)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal, healthy females >18 years of age
- In committed heterosexual relationship for >6months
- Of adequate sexual functioning
- On acceptable method of birth control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- Allergy to product ingredients
- Irritation or infection in genital area
- Unstable or uncontrolled medical condition

facility.name: Center of Marital and Sexual Health of South Florida
Center for Marital and Sexual Health, Inc.
